    • Constructor Detail

      • DbRemote

        public DbRemote​(org.qore.jni.QoreObject obj)

      • DbRemote

        public DbRemote​(java.lang.String remote,
                java.lang.String dsname,
                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> opts)
         throws java.lang.Throwable
        Constructor taking a string giving the name of the remoteconn "remote connection" for the remote server
        Parameters:
        remote - a string giving the name of the remoteconn "remote connection" for the remote server
        dsname - a string with name of the remote dsconn "datasource" to use
        opts - optional stream-api-options as follows:
        • "timeout": an HTTP socket timeout value in milliseconds; used locally and in the remote for socket I/O and queue operations; default value: "5m"
        • "loglevel": a default log level option for logging; see LogLevels for valid value
        • "no_remote_timeout": if True the "timeout" option will not be sent to the remote
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        Note:
        the explicit or default timeout value here overrides any socket I/O timeout set for the remote connection object

      • DbRemote

        public DbRemote​(java.lang.String remote,

        public DbRemote​(QorusSystemRestHelper remote,
                java.lang.String dsname,
                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> opts)
         throws java.lang.Throwable
        Constructor taking a com.qoretechnologies.qorus.QorusSystemRestHelper object for the remote server
        Parameters:
        remote - a com.qoretechnologies.qorus.QorusSystemRestHelper object for the remote server
        dsname - a string with name of the remote dsconn "datasource" to use
        opts - optional stream-api-options as follows:
        • "timeout": an HTTP socket timeout value in milliseconds; used locally and in the remote for socket I/O and queue operations; default value: "5m"
        • "loglevel": a default log level option for logging; see LogLevels for valid value
        • "no_remote_timeout": if True the "timeout" option will not be sent to the remote
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        Note:
        the explicit or default timeout value here overrides any socket I/O timeout set for the remote connection object

      • rollback

        public void rollback​(boolean disconnect)
              throws java.lang.Throwable
        Rollback remote transaction
        Parameters:
        disconnect - a boolean value to keep connection open or close the connection. Connection closing is the default
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        disconnect()
        Note:
        it's normally better to disconnect the connection if an error occurs rather than call rollback() when streaming because if a chunked transfer is interrupted, then HTTP calls will fail anyway, and the remote end will rollback the transaction in any case unless an explicit commit is executed

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
              throws java.lang.Throwable
        Rollback remote transaction and disconnect the connection
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        disconnect()
        Note:
        it's normally better to disconnect the connection if an error occurs rather than call rollback() when streaming because if a chunked transfer is interrupted, then HTTP calls will fail anyway, and the remote end will rollback the transaction in any case unless an explicit commit is executed

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
                throws java.lang.Throwable
        Disconnects the connection
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
